greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2, a(2n) = A055938(a(n)), a(2n+1) = A005187(a(n)).
comment: Note the indexing: the domain starts from 0, while the range excludes zero.
This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each left hand child is produced as A055938(n), and each right hand child as A005187(n), when the parent node contains n:
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
